intro: Angorkis ramosa, commonly known as the branched angorkis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Angorkis ramosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
